properties.areaDesc: Mason, WV; Putnam, WV; Jackson, WV
properties.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued January 11 at 3:52PM EST until January 11 at 4:15PM EST by NWS Charleston WV
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Charleston West Virginia has issued a

* Severe Thunderstorm Warning for...
Mason County in western West Virginia...
Northern Putnam County in western West Virginia...
Southern Jackson County in northwestern West Virginia...

* Until 415 PM EST.

* At 351 PM EST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line
extending from near Gallipolis to near Buffalo to near Milton,
moving northeast at 60 mph.

HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees.

* Locations impacted include...
Ripley, Winfield, Eleanor, Buffalo, Kenna, Leon, Mount Alto, Statts
Mills, Given, Southside, Kentuck, Liberty, Cottageville, Grimms
Landing, Evans, Fraziers Bottom and Fairplain.

This includes Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 117
and 143.
properties.instruction:
For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a
building.

Intense thunderstorm lines can produce brief tornadoes and widespread
significant wind damage. Although a tornado is not immediately
likely, it is best to move to an interior room on the lowest floor of
a building. These storms may cause serious injury and significant
property damage.

Please report severe weather to the National Weather Service by
calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.

You may also report severe weather by posting your report to the
Charleston West Virginia National Weather Service Facebook Page, or
by using the Twitter Hashtag, NWSRLX.
